body_html:
Hi. I'm the puller of lr_schedule. I fully agree with the origin post. However,

The simplest fix is to move .step() after validation in the other examples as well

This solution would make the concept of epoch become 'next_epoch', which is also not a reasonable design. I failed to come up with a better design, and I believe that the difference of calling time is reasonable and easy to understand -- one depends on index of epoch and another depends on the result of validation.

body:
Hi. I'm the puller of lr_schedule. I fully agree with the origin post. However, 

> The simplest fix is to move .step() after validation in the other examples as well

This solution would make the concept of `epoch` become 'next_epoch', which is also not a reasonable design. I failed to come up with a better design, and I believe that the difference of calling time is reasonable and easy to understand -- one depends on index of epoch and another depends on the result of validation.
